content.prompt: Which of the following is a correct conclusion that can be drawn from the data in Figures 1, 2, and 3?

choices.label: Most of the increase in the concentration of all gibberellins 40 to 45 days after planting is due to an increase in the concentration of GAl.
The concentration of all gibberellins is three times as great at 75 days as it is at 30 days after planting.
An increase in GAl levels occurs a day or two before the seedlings start to grow rapidly.
An increase in the concentration of GAl inhibits the synthesis of other gibberellins.
The concentration of GAl is a thousand times as great at 45 days as it is at 30 days after planting.

skill.text: 6.B: Support a claim with evidence from biological principles, concepts, processes, and data.
